DOCKAGE RATES AT LIBERTY HARBOR MARINA

YEAR ROUND: (04/15/20 - 04/14/21) ALL ANNUAL CONTRACTS RUN APRIL TO APRIL

Plan A: $285.00 per ft.

Summer Wet/Winter Dry
Includes: Fall Haul, Power Wash, Blocking & Storage

Summer Trailer Storage - $600

Plan B: $285.00 per ft.

Summer & Winter Wet

SEASONAL CONTRACTS

Summer Contract Only Contract (4/15/20 - 10/14/20)

Wet Storage: $215.00 per ft.
Land Storage: $90.00 per ft.

Winter Only Contract (10/15/20 - 04/14/20)

Wet Storage: $80.00 per ft.
Land Storage: $80.00 per ft.


MONTHLY DRY STORAGE

$17.16 per ft.

We offer many NYC boat storage options, such as land storage for one week or one month.

TRAILER STORAGE - APPLY'S TO 'PLAN A' ANNUAL CONTRACT ONLY

$600.00

Trailer storage for six months. All trailers have to be chained. Please chain your trailer and provide the Liberty Harbor Marina with a copy of the key and copy of the registration. Rates applicable for Marina Seasonal Customers.

HAUL OUTS

One Way

$7.32 per ft.

Short Haul

1 Houre in Slings $12.00 per ft.

With pressure wash: $4.00 per ft + lift fee. When short Hauls exceed 1 hour, additional fees will be applied.

Long Haul

Haul, pressure wash, block, one week land storage & launch: $19.00 per ft.

Step the mast - $250

TRANSIENT DOCKAGE TRANSIENT SLIPS

We offer New York City transient slips and transient dockage for your convenience. Our transient dockage rates are listed below:

Short Term Stay in Peak Sesson (4/15/20 - 10/14/20)
Day $4.50 per foot 1 Day
Week $25.00 per foot 7 Days
Month $100.00 per foot 28 Days
Drop Off & Pick Up $12.00 per foot 1 drop off + 1 pick up (same day)
Short Term Stay in Off Peak Season (10/15/20 - 4/14/21)
Day $3.50 per foot 1 Day
Week $14.00 per foot 7 Days
Month $45.00 per foot 28 Days
Drop Off & Pick Up $12.00 per foot 1 drop off + 1 pick up (same day)
  • All boat contracts will include a 2.5% Environmental fee. Refundable gate key deposits are $25.00. Land storage in NJ is taxable at the effective annual sales tax rate.
  • All boaters must supply Marina with copy of vessel's registration and insurance declaration page when signing contracts. Liberty Harbor Marina & Dry Dock must be listed as additional insured for any contract holder.
  • All storage is NON-LIVEABOARD. Electric is metered. Please call PSE&G (contact marina office for your assigned meter #) and have bill sent to your home based on usage. All unmetered docks must pay $35 a month for electricity. 24 hour security patrol of premises.  When boats are stored in the Boat Yard, vessels hooked up to power will incur a monthly PSE&G charge of $35 per month (applicable if hooked up one day).
  • 1 Complimentary seasonal parking pass is provided for slipholders. All permit parking passes are subject to Liberty Harbor Marina  parking regulations.

*All listed rates reflect the payment in Cash/Check discount. For all other methods of payment rates are 3.5% higher.


Fill out this short form below with any questions or interestes you may have!

How Does this plan work

Vestibulum ante ipsum primis in faucibus orci luctus et ultrices posuere cubilia Curae; Donec velit neque, auctor sit amet aliquam vel, ullamcorper sit amet ligula. Curabitur non nulla sit amet nisl tempus convallis quis ac lectus. Nulla quis lorem ut libero malesuada feugiat. Vivamus suscipit tortor eget felis porttitor volutpat. Mauris blandit aliquet elit, eget tincidunt nibh pulvinar a.

Mauris blandit aliquet elit, eget tincidunt nibh pulvinar a.

How does the refund policy work?

Welcome to Trattoria Giuseppe

A Letter from the owner
Order Take-out By Phone

*For Take-Out by Phone: Please provide Name, Address, Phone, Time of Delivery, Meal Selections, along with Payment information.

About

Giuseppe Musso welcomes you to his Trattoria & wishes you a splendid evening, dining on the many culinary delights he has prepared for you. Creating an authentic Italian ristorante, Giuseppe recalled his past experiences as a chef in Sicily and Switzerland by designing his unique sauces & specialties. Using Southern Italian flair, he combines savory spices, cultivated seasonings, fresh vegetables, and delectable cheeses together with his array of tender meats, seafood, fish and pastas. To complete the experience, Giuseppe has provided for his guests a dining atmosphere that is reminiscent of a restaurant located in a Sicilian piazza. With authentic Italian clay tile, wrought iron, marble and wood fashioned together in stone & stucco, Giuseppe has produced a magnificent setting that will award his patrons a momentous evening in Italy.

Menu

Print Giuseppe Menu PDF






Lunch Menu

Lunch & Bar Packages (Sit Down)

Dinner & Bar Packages (Sit Down)

Celebration of Life Lunch & Bar Packages (Sit Down)

Bella Di Notte

Menu Packages

Gallery

Contact

Bella di Notte is the culmination of the Musso family’s dream to create one of the best banquet facilities in the area. The perfect event starts with the perfect place. Look no further than Bella de Notte located in Edgemont, PA. Welcome to a world where culinary delights, congenial service and warm surroundings come together at an ideal establishment for family, friends and associates.

We feature the exclusivity of a private waterfall entrance way, lighted on-site parking, as well as flexible spaces that adapt to meet individual needs for up to 200 guests. Large or small, formal or casual, Bella di Notte has the experience to make your wedding, special event or business function unforgettable. We take the time to listen to you to make sure every detail is just right.

Every aspect of Bella di Notte was carefully selected to enhance your enjoyment —

  • Beautiful, hand painted artwork of the Italian countryside.
  • Unique features such as stone walls and European

accents from chandeliers, mirrors, lighting and woodwork chosen for their classic appeal.

  • Colors that are warm and inviting.
  • Rooms to accommodate up to 200 guests.
  • Separate room controls to assure precise lighting and temperature levels.

The gathering you host at Bella di Notte will be the beginning of the tradition that will be requested for future celebrations and events.

Contact

Owner:

Giuseppe Musso

General Manager:

Alessandro Ferante

Sales Manager:

Angela Ruffino

Takeout Order By Phone

WE ARE STILL OPEN

We are practicing social distancing. Please call to place your food order.

Call us at 610-353-4871 for your Takeout Order!

Our hours are 12:00pm – 7:00pm, 7 days a week, until further notice.

Please call, place your order, and have the following available when you call:

  • Your food order
  • Time you are requesting it to be ready. Please allow at least 1 hour.
  • Name
  • Phone Number
  • Payment Information (Credit Card)
  • Email Address (so we can send you future offers and specials)

We also offer catering and party trays. Please allow at least 24 hours for your party tray order to be ready.

[contact-form-7 id="85" title="Bella Di Notte – Contact"]

Bella di Notte is the culmination of the Musso family’s dream to create one of the best banquet facilities in the area. The perfect event starts with the perfect place. Look no further than Bella de Notte located in Edgemont, PA. Welcome to a world where culinary delights, congenial service and warm surroundings come together at an ideal establishment for family, friends and associates.

We feature the exclusivity of a private waterfall entrance way, lighted on-site parking, as well as flexible spaces that adapt to meet individual needs for up to 200 guests. Large or small, formal or casual, Bella di Notte has the experience to make your wedding, special event or business function unforgettable. We take the time to listen to you to make sure every detail is just right.

Every aspect of Bella di Notte was carefully selected to enhance your enjoyment —

  • Beautiful, hand painted artwork of the Italian countryside.
  • Unique features such as stone walls and European

accents from chandeliers, mirrors, lighting and woodwork chosen for their classic appeal.

  • Colors that are warm and inviting.
  • Rooms to accommodate up to 200 guests.
  • Separate room controls to assure precise lighting and temperature levels.

The gathering you host at Bella di Notte will be the beginning of the tradition that will be requested for future celebrations and events.

Renewal Notification
 
 
 
 
Your subscription is about to renew!
 
We need to hear from you
 
%subscriber%, 

Your subscription to Family Business Magazine is ready to renew. But in order to process your renewal, we need for you to update the credit card information we currently have on file.
 
To update, click on the  Update Card Info  button below, sign in with your username and password and fill out the form. If you need help with your login, please  contact me directly for assistance.
 
Update Card Info
 

Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter.

Don't miss a single issue — enjoy your subscription! 


Jerri Smith-Baldwin 
Accounting & Circulation Coordinator  
Family Business/Directors & Boards 
jsmith@familybusinessmagazine.com
P: 215-405-6071 F: 215-405-6078

Sit Down Lunch Package For Any Occasion

Appetizer: (Served Family Style)

Bruschetta

Plus one appetizer of your choice

(not included #5, #7, #10a, #10b, #10c)

Salad:

Houde or Caesar

Entrée: (Individual)

Choice of Pasta, Chicken, Veal or Tilapia

Pre-select one each of the entrees from our menu

Dessert:

Gelato or Cannoli

Coffee, tea and soda included

$28.95 plus 6% tax and 20% gratuity

A small fee will apply for bringing dessert ($1.00 per person)

Available from 12:00pm-3:00pm, 1:00pm-4:00pm or 2:00pm-5:00pm

Please make your menu selection 4 weeks prior to your event

All desserts must be brought in with you at the time of your event

Open Bar

1 hour $14.00 Per Person

2 hour $16.00 Per Person

3 hour $19.00 Per Person

4 hour $25.00 Per Person

Beer & Wine packages

2 hour $14.00 Per Person

4 hour $18.00 Per Person

Tab Bar

Alcolol and Soft Drinks will be charged on consumption

Cash Bar

Each guest is responsible for purchasing their own drinks

Soft Drink Bar

An assortment of Soda, Juice, Iced Tea & lemonade for $3.25 Per Person

Self Service Soda Station:

Pitchers of Soda $7.00 each

*Bartender Fee

$75.00 lunch /$150.00 dinner bar fee

All prices are subject to a 20% Service Charge

6% PA Sales Tax will be charged on all non-alcoholic beverages

Select Two Pasta and Two Chicken dishes

(pastas not included #23, #33, #40, #41, and #44)

Desserts are not included (Dessert Price is $5.95 per person)

Soft drinks, coffee, and tea included

All desserts must be brought in with you at the time of your event

$35.95 Plus tax and gratuity

A small fee will apply for dessert and pastry

Available Sunday thru Thursday

  • Privacy Policy
  • Careers

Focus & Approach

We focus on lower-middle market companies in a variety of industries. We will acquire some or all the equity, as well as acquire a company’s debt. Typically, our opportunities have some level of under-performance and require various degrees of restructuring.

We are creative in our approach to every transaction, and never will apply a ‘play book’ approach to the transaction

Target Transactions

  • Public-to-private
  • Corporate carve-outs
  • $363 bankruptcy auctions
  • Debt purchases
  • UCC Article 9 Foreclosures

Industry Focus

  • Niche Industrial
  • Aerospace & Defense
  • Metals & Alloys
  • Chemicals

Our investments are businesses that have lost money, and likely will be liquidated. We provide speed and quality of execution in transactions – never price.

SUBSCRIPTION EXPIRE NOTIFICATION
Your subscription to Family Business Magazine will expire with the %issueInfo% issue. To continue enjoying your magazine delivery and unlimited online access without interruption of service, renew your subscription today. Family Business Magazine works hard every day to bring you the latest news, tips, analysis and trends impacting multi-generational family companies of all sizes.

Your subscription includes:
  • 6 information-packed issues per year
  • Unlimited online access to the www.familybusinessmagazine.com, which includes our full library of articles, webinars, and video interviews on all topics related to running a successful multi-generational family business
  • Our weekly Family Business newsletter which keeps you connected to real-time news and important insights as they are happening.
  • Notifications on upcoming conferences and webinars
Renew your subscription today! 
 

To renew online, click on the RENEW NOW button below, sign in with your username and password (if you need help with your login, please contact me directly for assistance) and fill out the online form.
RENEW NOW
Thank you and please don't hesitate to reach out to me if you have any questions!

Jerri Smith-Baldwin
Accounting & Circulation Coordinator
Family Business/Directors & Boards
jsmith@familybusinessmagazine.com
P: 215-405-6071 F: 215-405-6078

  • Evolving family business governance structures
  • Developing the rising generation
  • The pros and cons of board term limits
  • How trustees can build relationships with beneficiaries

We Miss You.
 
 
 
 
Subscribe today and get 2 FREE Issues!

%subscriber%, 

We've delivered a few issues since your subscription expired, so why not take another look?

Get unlimited access to the latest news, trends, in-depth interviews and how-to articles for multi-generational family businesses and enterprises. Gain insight on topics that impact your bottom line — succession, governance, wealth management and conflict resolution. 

Your annual subscription includes: 
  • 6 information-packed issues per year
  • Unlimited online access to the subscriber-only library of searchable articles on all topics related to running a successful multi-generational family business
  • Our weekly Family Business newsletter
  • Notifications on upcoming events and webinars
And, if you renew through this offer, we'll add 2 free issues to your subscription! Simply use the promo code:  FB2FREE  when renewing online and get 2 additional issues on us.  
 
 
To renew online, click on the  RENEW NOW  button below, sign in with your username and password (if you need help with your login, please  contact me directly for assistance ) and fill out the online form.
 
RENEW NOW
 
Thank you and please don't hesitate to reach out to me if you have any questions!  

Jerri Smith-Baldwin 
Accounting & Circulation Coordinator  
Family Business/Directors & Boards 
jsmith@familybusinessmagazine.com

OUR STORY

Cleft Lip and Palate Association of malaysia (CLAPAM) is the only nationwide
organisation in Malaysia supporting matters related to cleft.

  • 1992

    Nullam vel sem. Nullam vel sem.

  • 1993

    Nullam vel sem. Nullam vel sem. Integer ante arcu, accumsan.

  • Nullam vel sem. Nullam vel sem. Integer ante arcu, accumsan a, consectetuer eget, posuere ut, mauris. Donec orci lectus, aliquam ut, faucibus non, euismod id, nulla. Donec vitae sapien ut libero venenatis faucibus. ullam dictum felis eu pede mollis pretium. Pellentesque ut neque. Nullam vel sem. Nullam vel sem.

    Nullam vel sem. Nullam vel sem. Integer ante arcu, accumsan a, consectetuer eget, posuere ut, mauris. Donec orci lectus, aliquam ut, faucibus non, euismod id, nulla. Donec vitae sapien ut libero venenatis faucibus. ullam dictum felis eu pede mollis pretium. Pellentesque ut neque. Nullam vel sem.

ARE NOW

[[{"type":"media","fid":"79","view_mode":"media_original","instance_fields":"override","attributes":{"height":7,"width":56,"class":"media-image"}}]]

[[{"type":"media","fid":"1063","view_mode":"default","instance_fields":"override","field_file_image_alt_text[und][0][value]":"","field_file_image_title_text[und][0][value]":""}]]
What’s New minim veniam, quis nostrud exercitation ullamco laboris nisi ut aliquip ex ea commodo consequat.

We are very pleased to announce that Joseph Chen has joined Epolin as a Sales Engineer working in our Sales and Marketing Department. Joseph earned his Materials Science and Engineering degree at The University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign.

Prior to joining Epolin Joseph was a Materials Development Engineer for the Continental Structured Plastics division of Teijin Group Company. Before that he was a Research Intern at the Polymer Processing Institute in Newark, New Jersey.

SUBSCRIPTION EXPIRE NOTIFICATION
Dear %subscriber%,
 
Your subscription to Directors and Boards has expired and we really hate to see you go!
 
To restart delivery of your magazine and restore access to the unlimited online library of articles, videos and on-demand webinars at directorsandboards.com, please renew now.

You still have time to receive our upcoming %issueInfo% issue if you renew quickly, and here's a sneak peek at what's coming up:
 
  • Anyone’s Game: Scenarios for boards no matter who wins in November
  • Geopolitics in Governance
  • Board Recruitment in a Post In-Person World
Renew your subscription today! 
 

To renew online, click on the RENEW NOW button below, sign in with your username and password (if you need help with your login, please contact me directly for assistance) and fill out the online form.
RENEW NOW
Thank you and please don't hesitate to reach out to me if you have any questions!

Jerri Smith-Baldwin
Accounting & Circulation Coordinator
Family Business/Directors & Boards
jsmith@familybusinessmagazine.com
P: 215-405-6071 F: 215-405-6078
 

 


 
We Miss You.
 
 
Re-Subscribe today and SAVE 20%!

%subscriber%, 

We've delivered a few issues since your subscription expired, so why not take another look?

Directors & Boards takes on tough corporate governance issues. Our continued coverage of ESG and issues of risk and diversity are even more useful now as we face today’s — and tomorrow’s — challenges. Now more than ever, turn to Directors & Boards for best practices and solid corporate governance strategies

Your annual subscription includes: 
  • 4 information-packed issues per year + our special Annual Report edition.
  • Unlimited online access to the www.directorsandboards.com, which includes our full library of articles, webinars, and video interviews on all topics related to corporate governance.
  • Our weekly Directors and Boards newsletter which keeps you connected to real-time news and important insights as they are happening.
  • Notifications on upcoming conferences and webinars

And, if you renew through this offer, save 20% off the regular subscription price by using the promo code: DB20.

 

 
To renew online, click on the  RENEW NOW  button below, sign in with your username and password (if you need help with your login, please  contact me directly for assistance ) and fill out the online form.
 
RENEW NOW
 
Thank you and please don't hesitate to reach out to me if you have any questions!  

Jerri Smith-Baldwin 
Accounting & Circulation Coordinator  
Family Business/Directors & Boards 
jsmith@familybusinessmagazine.com
P: 215-405-6071 C: 267-808-9206

ADDRESS

333 GRAND STREET, JERSEY
CITY, NJ 07302

221

UNITS

12

STORIES

2017

BUILT

The journey to your dream home at 333 Grand begins when you walk through the Liberty Harbor neighborhood and experience the community that exists within the charming streets of Jersey City. Your journey continues as you enter the spacious lobby with concierge service. Travel past exclusive state-of-the-art fitness and social amenities, including a yoga studio, screening room, golf simulator, playroom and an outdoor pool with a hot tub. Enter into your own space boasting sleek modern interiors, 10’ ceilings, oversized triple-pane windows, gourmet kitchen, and keyless fob entry. The building is a beautiful addition to our Liberty Harbor Community with an iconic curved facade, oversized windows, and wide sidewalk area. All details have been thought through to provide residents with a grand living experience.

ADDRESS

10 REGENT STREET, JERSEY
CITY, NJ 07302

134

UNITS

8

STORIES

2007

BUILT

The Sutton at Liberty Harbor offers residents the best of all worlds living in Jersey City condominium real estate. The vibrant, dynamic Liberty Harbor community of Jersey City surrounds our residents with diverse architectural landscapes, while the building itself offers a world of services, amenities, the latest integrated home technology, and an intimate social environment. Liberty Harbor condo owners at The Sutton in Jersey City enjoy the very best of community life; from the finest finishes and latest technology in their homes, to the building amenities and the vibrant community just outside their door.

  • Contemporary Cherry style vanity with white corian countertop
  • “Urban Steel” glazed porcelain tile floors
  • White matte finished porcelain tile tub surround
  • Chrome faucets and fixtures
  • Oversized mirrored medicine cabinet

About Rayyanocnt

Our Branches

Keep in touch!

Subscribe to our newsletter

Why choose us

  • Because we offer a great service in designing your strategy, in developing your business, in simplifying your processes and in bringing new technologies inside your company.
  • Because we love what we do and we bring enthusiasm and commitment to every project we work on. Put simply, we care about your business.
  • Because we listen to your ideas, plans and objectives for your business. We discuss and then we advice. If we feel we’re not a good fit, we’ll be honest and tell you from the outset.
  • Because our strong sense of identification with your projects means that we are constantly striving to provide solutions, even for issues you aren’t yet aware of.

Excellence in Consultancy
Services since 2012

{{ body }}

“Professionalism, know-how and experiences of ICT team are an excellent business card to introduce MAEET2. Punctuality in information and in orders management with final customer are a strength point of ICT and a guarantee of success.”

GIANLUCA BORGO Managing Director, MAEET2 srl (Italy)

“ICT professionals have proved their strength in last 5 years transforming NHB management practices from family oriented to professional oriented business, at all levels (technical as well commercial and financial fields). They revolved the company culture and people mindset by making each employee more accountable and by changing the company focus to customers.”

PRASHANT MISTRY Business Unite Head, NHB Ball & Roller Ltd (India)

“ICT is our strategic partner to upgrade the technology and customer base globally. We are very much pleased with the support they have extended in the last 5 years. They helped to transform company and to bring us to the next levels. Today we are appreciated by our customers for the speediest improvement in quality, cost and services, credit goes to ICT who has put all the efforts in getting these results.”

MANISH PATEL Business Unit Head, NHB Ball & Roller Ltd (India)

“ICT expertise and dedication helped NHB Group to gain global foot print in 5 years in ball manufacturing. With know-how in lean manufacturing and waste reduction, they helped us in rubbing shoulders with global competitors. If you are looking to transform your company, I strongly reccomend ICT as a partner.”

KALPESH METHA CEO, NHB Ball & Roller Ltd (India)

“With 5 years’ cooperation, we understand ICT is the most reliable partner in Europe. ICT is professional, knowledgeable and honest on bearings and rollers business.”

WANG YANG Sales Manager, Wafangdian Weiyuan Bearing Manufacturings Co. Ltd (China)

Leggings occaecat craft beer farm-to-table, raw denim aesthetic synth nesciunt you probably haven't heard of them accusamus labore sustainable VHS.

Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipisicing elit, sed do eiusmod tempor incididunt ut labore et dolore magna aliqua. Ut enim ad minim veniam, quis nostrud exercitation ullamco laboris nisi ut aliquip ex ea commodo consequat. Duis aute irure dolor in reprehenderit in voluptate velit esse cillum dolore eu fugiat nulla pariatur. Excepteur sint occaecat cupidatat non proident, sunt in culpa qui officia deserunt mollit anim id est laborum.

Private Company Boards of the Year Nominations Open

By Private Company Director

Honoring private company boards which best serve ownership, shareholders, employees, community and the business as a whole

 

Each year, Private Company Director, Family Business Magazine and Directors & Boards Magazine highlight fiduciary and advisory boards of private companies of all sizes and ownership structures which exhibit corporate governance best practices far beyond those required by law.

 

Read about our 2020 Awardees

Read about our 2019 Awardees

Read about our 2018 Awardees

Read about our 2017 Awardees

Do you want to save money? Just pay for what you watch? Let us help you to
lower your bill!!! Gold coast Brodband will help you and inform you to cut
the cord and enjoy the streaming world.

I'M READY!, I WANT TO CANCEL MY TV SERVICE

How?

STEEP 1

What Internet package do you have from us? Make
sure that the speed with support all your equipment
and the streaming.

STEEP 2

Pick your device! What equipment will you use to
steam your favorites shows? The most popular are
Fire Stick, Apple TV, Chromecast, PlayStation, and
Xbox or you may have a smart TV.

Welcome to the Cord-cutting world, to check for information and updates about the
newest options we recommend:

https://www.allconnect.com/blog/the-ultimate-guide-to-cutting-the-cord

I'M READY!, I WANT TO CANCEL MY TV SERVICE

Gold cold Broadband takes pride in the excellent service we provide our subscribers. We feel obligated to share with you how to save money and stream HD TV content in the 21st century.

You'll be able to stream content to all of your devices, anywhere, anytime. There are a lot of live streaming servicesavailable, and it may seem overwhelming, but it is easier then you think!

Resources

1. CORD CUTTRTS NEWS

https://www.cordcuttersnews.com

2. CHANNEL MASTER

http://www.channelmaster.com/Cord_Cutting_Guide_a/332.html

3. CORD CUTTING REPORT

http://www.cordcuttingreport.com/cord-cutting-guide

4. NO CABLE

https://nocable.org/news/the-complete-cord-cutting-resource-list/

Option

ONLINE ONLY

FAQ:

Click to Access the TV Troubleshooting

If you

  • Have trouble hearing in noisy environments
  • Need to turn your TV up loud to hear it, or
  • Frequently ask people to repeat themselves

You need to take advantage of this offer. No matter what level of hearing loss you’re experiencing, the friendly staff at Audiology & Hearing Centers can find out which of the latest, cutting-edge technologies best fit your condition.


This offer includes:

  • Free hearing consultation
  • Free cleaning of any current hearing aids
  • Free demonstration of new Muse iQ Hearing Aids by Starkey

30% off the latest hearing technology

If you

  • Have trouble hearing in noisy environments
  • Need to turn your TV up loud to hear it
  • Frequently ask people to repeat themselves

Now is the time to come see us!

Welcome to GoldCoast Broadband.

We keep you connected.

Why Us???

  • 100% Fiber to your apartment, we are truly Symmetrical!!
  • The same day, next day, or even Day before installation.
  • No data caps.
  • Neutral internet browsing.
  • No bandwidth throttling.
  • Single-digit latency.
  • Your data is safe with us, thanks to our strong privacy policy (we never share your browsing data with anyone).

What do you need to know???

No early
termination fees
No
contract
No
surprises

E
Eileen
★★★★★ 5 weeks aga

Setup was super easy, thanks to margarita, who was able to flip on my service right away. Rui the technician was right on tome for the appointment and was extremely professional. He helped me reconfigure my wifi and also helped set up several wall ports. internet service has been good so far and setup was a thousand times easier then many of the big competing ISPs. Thank you!!

S
Shawn Kim
★★★★★ 7 weeks aga

Great service! Rui came immediately to fix my issue and was courteous to ewar a mask and take off his shoes.


B
Brian S
★★★★★ 8 weeks aga

Recently experienced slowness within internet service. 1 call to Gold Coast resulted in onsite customer service visit within hours. Dharmit Viradia isentified the issue with the connecting wire and fixed within minutes. He then remained on site to ensure my Wifi, internet and computer was oparating at high speeds. His knowledge and customer service is the best! Gold Coast is family owned and you receive personal service. Verizon cannot compete!

নূরাণী

প্লে, নার্সারি, ১ম, ২য়, ৩য় শ্রেণী পর্যন্ত ।

নাজেরা

মাত্র ৪০ দিনে কুরআনের সবক প্রদান ।

হিফজ

মাত্র ২ বছরে সবক সমাপ্ত ।

কিতাব

উর্দুখানা- কাফিয়া জামাত পর্যন্ত।

About Us

মাদ্রাসাটি সার্বক্ষণিক ওয়েব ক্যামেরা দ্বারা নিয়ন্ত্রিত এবং নিজস্ব ওয়েব সাইটটের মাধ্যমে শিক্ষা কারিকুলাম পরিচালনা করা হয় ।

নূরাণী বিভাগের বৈশিষ্টসমূহ:

  • অভিজ্ঞ শিক্ষকমন্ডলী দ্বারা ক্লাস পরিচালনা ।
  • আরবীর পাশাপাশি জেনারেল শিক্ষার উপর গুরুত্ব প্রদান ।
  • বাংলা ও ইংরেজি লেখার উপর বিশেষ গুরুত্ব প্রদান ।
  • কৃতি ছাত্র/ছাত্রীদের পুরুস্কাররে ব্যাবস্তা ।

নাজেরা ও হিফজ বিভাগের বৈশিষ্টসমূহ:

  • নাজেরা পশিক্ষণপ্রাপ্ত শিক্ষক দ্বারা ক্লাস পরিচালনা ।
  • ৬ মাস নাজেরা (কোরআন শরীফ ) সম্পন্ন ।
  • আন্তজাতিক মানের প্রশিক্ষণ প্রাপ্ত হাফেজ দ্বারা শিক্ষাদান ।
  • আরব বিশ্বের প্রসিদ্ধ কারীদের অডিও ক্যাসেট শোনানোর মাধ্যমে প্রশিক্ষণ প্রদান ।
  • উৎসাহ উদ্দীপনা সৃষ্টির লক্ষ্যে জাতীয় ও আন্তজাতিক হিফজুল কোরআন প্রতিযোগিতায় অংশগ্রহণ ।
  • তাজবীদ ভিত্তিক বিশুদ্ধ উচ্চারণে সুন্দর সুললিত কণ্ঠে তিলওয়াত শেখার সুব্যাবস্থা ।

কিতাব বিভাগের বৈশিষ্টসমূহ:

  • হাফেজ ছাত্রদের জন্য ১ বছরে উর্দু ও ফারসি জামাত পড়ার সু-ব্যবস্তা ।
  • দৈনিক ইজরা ও মাসিক মোনাজারার মাধ্যমে নাহু সরফের শিক্ষা প্রদান ।
  • ছাত্রদের জন্য কম্পিউটার শিখার সু-ব্যবস্তা ।
  • আরবি ভাষায় বক্তৃতা ও দরখাস্ত লিখার উপর গুরুত্ব প্রদান ।
  • আবাসিক ছাত্রদের পড়া-লেখা, বিশ্রাম, খাবার, বিনোদন ইত্যাদি রুটিন মাফিক পরিচালনা করা ।
  • সার্বক্ষণিক বিদ্যুৎ/I.P.S - এর সু-ব্যবস্থা এবং দৈনিক তিন বেলা রুটিন মাফিক খাবারের বাবস্থা ।

What's IR

Learn about infrared light and its relationship to visible and ultraviolet light in the electromagnetic spectrum

Products

Select the best dye or compound for your optical or laser application

Absorbance/Transmittance

Click here to convert absorbance to % transmittance or % transmittance to absorbance

Latest Blog

Visible Opaque Infrared Transmitting Dyes for Thermoplastics

Epolin produces a large selection of near infrared (NIR) and visible absorbing dyes. Epolin also incorporates these dyes into formulated dye blends and compounded thermoplastic pellets.  

  •

Contact Us

24/7 Customer Support: 201-763-5100

Customersupport@goldcoastbroadband.com

Billing Department:

201-763-5200

Billing@goldcoastbroadband.com

Monday-Friday from 8am to 4:30pm

Embed Speed Test

Before You Test:

Make sure that nobody else is connected online. We recommend that you use a ethernet cable connected to a wall port or the equipment, to get an accurate result. Ethernet cables delivers data much more reliably than WiFi.

What Is IT?

A speed test is a free web-based service to measure the internet speed that you are receiving.

What Can Influence The Speed Test Results?

A good Service / Broadband is more than your connection, different factors will affect your equipment, the age of your devices or computer, the number of people connected.

Download Or Upload, What Matter?

Download speed: Determinate how fast the information travels from the internet (website-streaming app) to your home. For almost every activity you do on the internet, download speed is going to be the most important factor.
Upload speed: We use it to send information from our homes/ devices to another location on the internet. We upload information all the time like posts on Facebook, send a picture, and every time that we click a link or search on Google. Uploading is an essential part of using the internet

Why Fiber?

Fiber optic cables have a core that carries light to transmit data. This allows fiber optic cables to carry signals at speeds that are only about 31 percent slower than the speed of light—faster than Cat5 or Cat6 copper cables. There is also less signal degradation with fiber cables. Fiber is also the most reliable type of connection, making your Livestream much less likely to have issues.
style="background: url('');"

পণ্য
লক্ষ্যমাত্রা (মে. টন) মোট সংগৃহিত পরিমাণ (রেজিষ্টার সূত্রে) মে. টন সংগ্রহের অবশিষ্ট পরিমাণ (মে. টন) দৈবচয়ন নমুনায়নের মাধ্যমে বাছাই বিনির্দেশ সংক্রান্ত মতামত ও মন্তব্য

গম
(খ) ধান ছাঁটায়ের জন্য মিলের অনুকূলে বরাদ্দকৃত ধানের পরিমাণ
(গ) মিলে বরাদ্দকৃত ধানের বিপরীতে প্রাপ্ত ফলিত চালের পরিমাণ
(ঘ) যে ধান দেয়া হয়েছে সে ধানের মান সম্মত চাল পাওয়া যাচ্ছে কিনা
(ঙ) ডিজিটাল ওজন পরিমাপ মেশিন যথাযথ ব্যবহার হচ্ছে কিনা
(চ) বস্তায় স্টেনশীল যথাযথ ব্যবহার হচ্ছে কিনা
১০। খাদ্যশস্য বিতরণ সংক্রান্ত তথ্যাদিঃ
ক্রমিক নং খাদ্যশস্য বিতরণ সংক্রান্ত তথ্যাদি
মতামত
হ্যাঁ না
মন্তব্য
(ক) খাদ্যশস্য বিতরণ আদেশ মোতাবেক নির্ধারিত সময়ের মধ্যে উত্তোলিত হচ্ছে কিনা
(খ) ডি,ওতে নির্ধারিত সময়ের মধ্যে পণ্য উত্তোলিত না হলে চাহিদাপত্র প্রদানকারী কর্তৃপক্ষের অনুমতি সাপেক্ষে এবং খাদ্য বিভাগের উদ্ধর্তন কর্তৃপক্ষকে জানিয়ে নির্দিষ্ট সময় পর্যন্ত সংরক্ষণ করা হচ্ছে কিনা
(গ) খাদ্যশস্য বিলি-বিতরণে ওয়ারেন্টি প্রথা যথাযথভাবে অনুসরণ করা হচ্ছে কিনা
(ঘ) নির্ধারিত দিন পর্যন্ত কি পরিমাণ বিতরণ হয়েছে
(মে. টন)
(ঙ) বস্তায় স্টেনসিল আছে কিনা/ সরবরাহকৃত বস্তায় বিতরণকৃত সীল আছে কিনা
(চ) সরবরাহকৃত বস্তায় বিতরণকৃত সীল আছে কিনা
১১। পরিদর্শনাধীন এলএসডি/ সিএসডিতে যন্ত্রপাতি/ দ্রব্যাদির মজুদ ও বর্তমান অবস্হাঃ
ক্রমিক নং যন্ত্রপাতির নাম ব্যবহারযোগ্য সংখ্যা ব্যবহার অযোগ্য সংখ্যা নিষ্পত্তির জন্য গৃহীত ব্যবস্হা মন্তব্য
(ক) ময়েশ্চার মিটার
(খ) ডিজিটাল ওজন যন্ত্র
(গ) স্প্রে মেশিন ও মুখোশ
(ঘ) জিপি শিট
(ঙ) ত্রিপল
(চ) স্ট্যান্ডার্ড ভোঙ্গা ব্যবহৃত হচ্ছে কিনা
(ছ) সরঞ্জামাদি যথাযথভাবে সংরক্ষণ করা হচ্ছে কিনা
(জ) অন্যান্য
১২। খাদ্যশস্য পরিবহণের ক্ষেত্রে ইনভয়েস/ ফেরত/ প্রতিস্বাক্ষর সম্পর্কিত চেকলিষ্টঃ
বিষয় হ্যাঁ না মন্তব্য
প্রেরিত পণ্যে ইনভয়েস এর ৪র্থ কপি সিলগালা করে রেজিট্রি ডাকে প্রাপক কেন্দ্রে প্রেরণ করা হয় কিনা (ষ্ট্যাম্প রেজিঃ, ইস্যু রেজিঃ ও ইনভয়েস বহি পরীক্ষা করে দেখুন)
প্রেরিত ও প্রাপ্ত খাদ্যশস্যের ফেরত ইনভয়েসসমূহের কপি সংরক্ষণ করা হয় কিনা (ব্যবহৃত ইনভয়েস বহিঃ সমূহ অবলোকন করুন)
এক মাসের উর্দ্ধে ইনভয়েস অপ্রাপ্তির সংখ্যা কতটি‌ এবং অনুসন্ধান ফর্ম জারি করা হয়েছে কিনা
প্রেরণ ও প্রাপ্তি পণ্য গুদাম রেজিষ্টার সাপ্তাহিক মজুদ প্রতিবেদন অন্তর্ভূক্ত করা হয়েছে কিনা (সাপ্তাহিক ইনভয়েস বিবরণী ও প্রাপ্তি বিবরণী)
মিলে ধান প্রেরণ ও ফলিত চাল প্রাপ্তি বিষয়ক তথ্যাদি লেজারে লিপিবদ্ধ করা হয় কিনা (এমডিএফ/এমআরএফ দেখুন)
সীমিত গুদাম/ পরিবহণ ঘাটতি প্রস্তাব যথা-সময়ে অবলোপন করা হয়েছে কিনা? (স্টোক কার্ড গুদাম লেজার দেখুন)
১৩। অন্যান্য তথ্যাদিঃ
চেকলিষ্ট মতামত/ মন্তব্য
গুদামে স্হান সংকট আছে কিনা
ডিজিটাল মেশিন ব্যবহৃত হচ্ছে কিনা
ওয়েইং ব্রিজ সঠিক আছে কিনা
ধান সংগ্রহে কোন প্রতিবন্ধকতা আছে কিনা
ফাইল/ রেজিষ্টার ব্যবস্হাপনা যথাযথ কিনা
রেকর্ডপত্রাদি লিপিবদ্ধকরণ হালনাগাদ আছে কিনা
সংরক্ষিত খাদ্যশস্যে কিটের প্রাদুর্ভাব পরিলক্ষিত হচ্ছে কিনা
১৪। প্রশিক্ষণ
অর্থ বছর প্রশিক্ষণের নাম সময়কাল প্রশিক্ষণার্থীর সংখ্যা মন্তব্য
১৫। সার্বিক মন্তব্য ও সুপারিশঃ
সুপারিশ যোগ করুন

How?

STEP 1

What Internet package do you have from us? Make sure that the speed with support all your equipment and the streaming.

STEP 2

Pick your device! What equipment will you use to steam your favorites shows? The most popular are Fire Stick, Apple TV, Chromecast, PlayStation, and Xbox or you may have a smart TV.

STEP 3

MIX AND MATCH STREAMING SERVICESNETFLIX, HULU, YOUTUBE TV, A LA CARTE

STEP 4

YOU HAVE CUT THE (CABLE) CORD

STEP 5

WATCH HD CONTENT AND SAVE $$
Welcome to the Cord-cutting world, to check for information and updates about the newest options we recommend: https://www.allconnect.com/blog/the-ultimate-guide-to-cutting-the-cord

    Epolight™ dyes for thermoplastics

These products are known as near infrared cut-on filters or long wavelength band-pass filters.  They are designed to block UV and visible light while transmitting NIR light.

Epolin offers dye powders and thermoplastic compounds with VOIRT properties.

  • Epolight VOIRT dyes for thermoplastic compounding

  • Epolight VOIRT dyes for solvent based systems

  • Luminate VOIRT ready-to-mold compounds

These products are known as near infrared cut-on filters or long wavelength band-pass filters.  They are designed to block UV and visible light while transmitting NIR light.

Epolin offers dye powders and thermoplastic compounds with VOIRT properties.

  • Epolight VOIRT dyes for thermoplastic compounding

  • Epolight VOIRT dyes for solvent based systems

  • Luminate VOIRT ready-to-mold compounds

These products are known as near infrared cut-on filters or long wavelength band-pass filters.  They are designed to block UV and visible light while transmitting NIR light.

Epolin offers dye powders and thermoplastic compounds with VOIRT properties.

  • Epolight VOIRT dyes for thermoplastic compounding

  • Epolight VOIRT dyes for solvent based systems

  • Luminate VOIRT ready-to-mold compounds

Corporate Profile

Epolin is the recognized leader in the development and manufacture of near-infrared absorbing dyes and thermoplastic compounds. Our materials add premium performance to laser & welding eyewear, security inks, light filters, touch screens and night vision products.

Epolin was founded in 1983 and resides in the famous Ironbound neighborhood of Newark, New Jersey. Epolin is a division of Chroma Color Corporation.

Our Capabilities

  • Synthesis of pure dyes and complex dye blends
  • Technical support from customer concept through commercialization
  • Products to meet transmittance or absorbance requirements in the UV, Visible or NIR spectra
  • Computer simulation to create spectra of complex dye formulae

Compounded thermoplastic dye pellets in any quantity

Contact Us

To contact Epolin, click here.

Laser Absorbing Compounds

Epolin can provide Epolight™ dyes or Luminate™ pellets that are designed for blocking specific laser wavelengths. We can meet the Absorbance or Optical Density requirements for one or more laser wavelengths while maximizing the Visible Light Transmittance of your thermoplastic lens or window.

The table below provides examples of several of the laser compounds that Epolin offers. Please contact us with your specific requirements.

A = 2 - log10 %T



Convert Transmittance to Absorbance
%T
 
A
 
   
Convert Absorbance to Transmittance
A
 
%T
 
   
      

Absorbance (optical density)

Light Transmittance %

0

100%   

1

   10          

2

1         

3

0.1      

4

0.01    

5

0.001  

6

0.0001

 

At an absorbance of 6, only one 10,000th of one percent of a particular wavelength is being transmitted through the filter (lens). Absorbance is measured with a spectrophotometer, which establishes the light transmission and calculates the absorbance.  However, the spectrophotometer can only measure absorbance up to 4.5 directly.  Beyond this level all values must be extrapolated.  For example, if a 2 mm thick filter is measured to have an absorbance of 3, then it is assumed that a 4 mm thick filter should have an absorbance of 6.

These products are known as near infrared cut-on filters or long wavelength band-pass filters.  They are designed to block UV and visible light while transmitting NIR light.

Epolin offers dye powders and thermoplastic compounds with VOIRT properties.

  • Epolight VOIRT dyes for thermoplastic compounding

  • Epolight VOIRT dyes for solvent based systems

  • Luminate VOIRT ready-to-mold compounds

Talix is a SaaS health information technology company serving payers and healthcare providers.  The Talix Platform uses purpose-built natural language processing (NLP) and machine learning (ML) techniques to power workflow applications that help healthcare organizations shift to value-based care.  Talix's cloud-hosted applications read structured and unstructured  patient data to extract accurate reimbursement codes, identify gaps in care, and analyze population health trends.  These solutions drive customer revenue and reduce administrative costs. Talix leads the market in addressing everywhere that risk adjustment is applied. We enable payers and providers who participate in Medicare Advantage, Managed Medicaid, ACA commercial and Medicare ACO programs. Our cloud-based applications also enable organizations to work virtually anywhere, especially when your teams and partners are required to work from home.

Talix Overview
  • MAY 22, 2020
  • •
  • < 1 MIN READ
  • •
  • VIDEOS

Talix provides data analytics applications to help providers, payers and accountable care organizations gain deeper patient insights, improve patient risk management, achieve better outcomes and reduce costs.

Talix Overview
  • MAY 22, 2020

  • < 1 MIN READ

Talix Overview
  • MAY 22, 2020
  • •
  • < 1 MIN READ
  • •
  • VIDEOS

Talix provides data analytics applications to help providers, payers and accountable care organizations gain deeper patient insights, improve patient risk management, achieve better outcomes and reduce costs.

VIRTUAL ESTIMATES

Another key component supporting Artificial Intelligence is Machine Learning (ML).  The Talix Machine Learning framework employs a vast array of accumulated clinical and non-clinical input data to recognize data behavior patterns across large patient data sets.  We call these “recognition models.”  We refine these models into a self-learning system that continuously integrates user feedback to achieve higher and higher levels of accuracy. Accuracy is derived from two measurements: precision and recall. Recall represents how well the system captured all true results. Precision measures the percentage of results that were produced that were true. The combination of the 2 measures represents accuracy.  Accuracy below 100% typically means that the system has identified false positive and false negative results along with true results.  The goal of ML is to reduce the number of false results. The Talix team gained first exposure to Artificial Intelligence techniques in the late 1980s through projects in the financial services industry.  By the early 2000s, Talix engineers and healthcare data scientists came together in a Talix predecessor company to develop AI components strictly for the healthcare industry.  Today, our experience in applying healthcare AI techniques covers a broad swath of healthcare, including consumer health, oncology, medication impact on chronic conditions, medical professional content publishing, and so on.  Much of the work involved projects completed for the Fortune 100 of healthcare. ML encompasses a number of analytical techniques honed by world leading computer scientists and mathematicians.  Talix employs a number of these techniques in the analysis of large patient data sets. The features that contribute to ML accuracy are aggregated over a large number of patient encounters and charts.  These features expand over time to increase the accuracy of results.  Features may include the exact text representing an ICD10 code, the section of the chart where the code is found, the document type (consult note), evidence of active treatment, and many more. Our approach to ML is customer-centric. The Talix ML model takes learnings from across all of our customers and applies learnings to all users.  At scale, Talix processes millions of patient encounters, which is fundamental to finding statistically relevant output to improve the precision component of accuracy.  As depicted in the exhibit below, our customers are directly involved in understanding the value ML provides.  For example, our Coding Insight customers provide input automatically into a live ML feedback system.  Clinical findings that are not identified as accurate are separated into false positive and false negative findings. The Talix Platform ingests these inputs to be processed through “recognition models” on a test basis.  Positive impacts on precision and recall are then sent back to the Talix Platform to train and improve the software. Hover
Hover
Hover

Bangladesh is known as the country of six seasons. It has an ideal weather for agriculture and hence, the cultivation of fruits and vegetables. The opportunity to utilise this scope for business inspired the late Amjad Khan Chowdhury to put his mastery to excellent use. He had a vision that would not only serve the society and its people, but would also create a business that would redefine the food manufacturing industry. And thus, PRAN was born in the year 1981. A successful period of 5 years led to the diversification of PRAN’s operations into agriculture in 1986 through contract farming, with the coordination of AMCL, (Agriculture Marketing Company Limited)..

PRAN further cemented its place in the industry through a food processing plant at Ghorashal in 1992. Coming through this period of endeavor, PRAN has now established itself as one of the top manufacturing companies and has set the grounds for development for any potentialities.

Video

Philadelphia, PA 19103

(215) 567-3200

2020 Advertising and Sponsorship Information

 

Your Demand and Lead Generation Partner to Reach

Top Public and Private Company Boards

 

Access the fast-growing and hard-to-reach private and family company governance market through Private Company Director--in print, online and in person.

Private Company Director is the first and only media brand which focuses entirely on the governance of privately-owned companies. Our audience includes directors, owners and shareholders of closely-held, family-owned and private-equity owned companies, as well as corporate governance advisors, private equity firms and more.

[logos_slider title="" items="-1" height="100" speed="500" ]
[space ]
[space ]
[three_fourth class="" last="no" ]

Elliott W. Wislar has a living family legacy that spans more than four generations in the Princeton, New Jersey area, which can easily be seen and felt through the numerous professional and charitable endeavors.

While excelling in his career, Elliott has continued that philosophy of giving back and has maintained an actively strong role in his community and various charitable organizations.

As it relates to business, his ancestors were early settlers to Martha’s Vineyard in the 1680’s and established a strong reputation for business. One could say that being a pioneer and forging new ground is rooted in the Wislar family, and they would be right.

Elliott founded Clearbrook Global Advisors ten years ago as an innovative financial advisory firm focused on transparency and providing agnostic research based solutions to a variety of endowments and foundations, public pensions, Fortune 500 companies and family offices.

The firm is headquartered in New York City with employees based internationally.

 

[/three_fourth][one_fourth class="" last="yes" ][/one_fourth]
[space ]
[space ]

[space ]
[box_title class="" border="middle" ]About Elliott Wislar[/box_title]

[caption id="attachment_94" align="alignright" width="300"] Fishers Island IOD Worlds[/caption]

Elliott built a Championship reputation in sailing, and has achieved the same reputation as a highly acclaimed business professional. He has held senior executive positions in marketing, distribution and Asset Management with FleetBoston, The Boston Company (a division of Bank of New York, Mellon, and UBS.).

In 2005, Elliott founded Clearbrook Global Advisors (Clearbrook) based upon the philosophy that the marketplace needed a financial advisory firm that provided client- centric solutions that at its core was dedicated to providing clients with non-conflicted and transparent advice. He has grown Clearbrook both domestically and internationally and advises and manages over $10 billion in assets today.

[caption id="attachment_97" align="alignleft" width="300"] Lost Mast Bermuda IOD Worlds[/caption]

Elliott attributes Clearbrook’s success to his sense of humility and the ability to be able to “look at things a little differently. Elliott speaks passionately about his love of sailing and business. “In sailing we have a concept known as ‘Velocity Made Good.’ An experienced sailor avoids sailing too close into the wind or directly down wind, but instead accounts for variations such as currents, and wind changes, to maximize speed and reach the finish line first. Business,” Elliott continues, “is no different. We must constantly adjust our strategies to the ever-changing business climate to provide our clients with the optimum solutions for reaching their goals. The era of five-year business plans has disappeared and we must move at the speed of business. This demands we create and adjust 6-month tactical plans to stay ahead of our business competition and to assist our clients with the ever changing markets, just as we adjust our sails and positioning on our boat to actively maintain our edge.”

[caption id="attachment_99" align="alignright" width="300"] Nantucket Invitational 1st Place[/caption]

Nearly 60% of Clearbrook’s clients are Foundations and Endowments (half of those are religious in nature). Elliott has served on many Boards of Foundations and Endowments. He and his family created the Mary Elliott Memorial Scholarship Foundation to honor both the memory of his mother as a pioneer for women seeking higher education, and to create scholarships for women entering college as freshmen in New Jersey. Further, he understands the importance of a Fiduciary relationship as the cornerstone of Asset Management. As Elliott explains: “In the spirit of the great Jurist, Benjamin Cardoza, A Fiduciary is held to something much stricter than simply the morals of the marketplace. A Fiduciary must not just demonstrate honesty, he must become, as Cardoza said, ‘the punctilio of an honor so sensitive, that it is the standard of all of his behavior.’ I take this role very seriously as does each and every member of our Clearbrook Team.”

Elliott has achieved success in business by applying wisdom and tactics from his greatest influencers: His Grandfather, who was the founder of several successful companies and taught Elliott a “Never-say-die” attitude, and four-star General and Commander of the U.S. Central Command, Norman Schwarzkopf, Jr., a Trenton, New Jersey native, who Elliott says, “showed his troops on the battlefield to never remain sedentary. Those that remain sedentary in business will never win the battle.”

Elliott Wakefield Wislar was educated at the University of Arizona with a BA in Political Science and an MBA in International Management with a focus in finance and Japanese language from The Thunderbird School of Global Management, Arizona State University. Elliott lives in Princeton, NJ, where his fourth-generation children were raised (Elliott Junior, Mackenzie and Wes). He enjoys sailing, fishing, golf, traveling the world, experiencing fine wine, reading and looking for new adventures.

[caption id="attachment_102" align="alignleft" width="300"] Maine IOD Worlds with Martha Stewart[/caption]

 

[space] [space] [parallax height="200" image="http://elliottwislar.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/bg1.jpg" color="#05144d" hover_color="#000" valign="center" halign="center" effect="fadeIn" button_size="small" ][space] Elliott W. Wislar is an American sailor. He has won two world championships in the International One Design yacht race (2011 & 2010). [/parallax] [space] [space]

Business

Familly

Sport

Success can be measured in the depth of one’s commitment to winning and to one another

– anonymous

Elliott W. Wislar

has a living family legacy that spans more than four generations in the Princeton, New Jersey area, which can easily be seen and felt through the numerous professional and charitable endeavors.

While excelling in his career, Elliott has continued that philosophy of giving back and has maintained an actively strong role in his community and various charitable organizations.

As it relates to business, his ancestors were early settlers to Martha’s Vineyard in the 1680’s and established a strong reputation for business. One could say that being a pioneer and forging new ground is rooted in the Wislar family, and they would be right.

Elliott founded Clearbrook Global Advisors ten years ago as an innovative financial advisory firm focused on transparency and providing agnostic research based solutions to a variety of endowments and foundations, public pensions, Fortune 500 companies and family offices.

The firm is headquartered in New York City with employees based internationally.

http://elliottwislar.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/sail.jpg

About Elliott Wislar

Elliott built a Championship reputation in sailing, and has achieved the same reputation as a highly acclaimed business professional. He has held senior executive positions in marketing, distribution and Asset Management with FleetBoston, The Boston Company (a division of Bank of New York, Mellon, and UBS.).

In 2005, Elliott founded Clearbrook Global Advisors (Clearbrook) based upon the philosophy that the marketplace needed a financial advisory firm that provided client- centric solutions that at its core was dedicated to providing clients with non-conflicted and transparent advice. He has grown Clearbrook both domestically and internationally and advises and manages over $10 billion in assets today.

Elliott attributes Clearbrook’s success to his sense of humility and the ability to be able to “look at things a little differently. Elliott speaks passionately about his love of sailing and business. “In sailing we have a concept known as ‘Velocity Made Good.’ An experienced sailor avoids sailing too close into the wind or directly down wind, but instead accounts for variations such as currents, and wind changes, to maximize speed and reach the finish line first. Business,” Elliott continues, “is no different. We must constantly adjust our strategies to the ever-changing business climate to provide our clients with the optimum solutions for reaching their goals. The era of five-year business plans has disappeared and we must move at the speed of business. This demands we create and adjust 6-month tactical plans to stay ahead of our business competition and to assist our clients with the ever changing markets, just as we adjust our sails and positioning on our boat to actively maintain our edge.”

Nearly 60% of Clearbrook’s clients are Foundations and Endowments (half of those are religious in nature). Elliott has served on many Boards of Foundations and Endowments. He and his family created the Mary Elliott Memorial Scholarship Foundation to honor both the memory of his mother as a pioneer for women seeking higher education, and to create scholarships for women entering college as freshmen in New Jersey. Further, he understands the importance of a Fiduciary relationship as the cornerstone of Asset Management. As Elliott explains:

“In the spirit of the great Jurist, Benjamin Cardoza, A Fiduciary is held to something much stricter than simply the morals of the marketplace. A Fiduciary must not just demonstrate honesty, he must become, as Cardoza said, ‘the punctilio of an honor so sensitive, that it is the standard of all of his behavior.’ I take this role very seriously as does each and every member of our Clearbrook Team.”

Elliott has achieved success in business by applying wisdom and tactics from his greatest influencers: His Grandfather, who was the founder of several successful companies and taught Elliott a “Never-say-die” attitude, and four-star General and Commander of the U.S. Central Command, Norman Schwarzkopf, Jr., a Trenton, New Jersey native, who Elliott says, “showed his troops on the battlefield to never remain sedentary. Those that remain sedentary in business will never win the battle.”

Elliott Wakefield Wislar was educated at the University of Arizona with a BA in Political Science and an MBA in International Management with a focus in finance and Japanese language from The Thunderbird School of Global Management, Arizona State University. Elliott lives in Princeton, NJ, where his fourth-generation children were raised (Elliott Junior, Mackenzie and Wes). He enjoys sailing, fishing, golf, traveling the world, experiencing fine wine, reading and looking for new adventures.

TV FAQ

Sometimes my cable freezes, what should I do when this happens?

If cable service is freezing, it could be a number of things. Try to disconnect the cable box from power for one minute and reconnect. If there’s no response, please contact Customer Service to schedule an appointment.

My remote is not working

Please bring your remote to our office on 285 Grand Street, Jersey City during normal business hours. We will check it and change if is needed, the cost to replace it $25 per remote with the exception of faulty controls.

STB channels won’t change/No Audio

Make sure to first press/select the STB button on the remote. If it still doesn’t react, reboot the STB from power.

Clinically proven to deliver firmer, smoother and younger looking skin.

SKINEEZ® makes your daily skincare routine easier than ever.

Check out all our items at SKINEEZ® Online Store.

In fact, 89% of consumers considered re-infusing their SKINEEZ® with the Skincarewear® Garment Spray to be an easier task than applying a skincare cream once or twice daily!
INSTANT RESULTS
Look and feel slimmer
Increase moisture to skin
Gain softer and smoother skin
In a Consumer Perception Survey after wearing for 1 hour, 88% said that their skin felt soft and smoother; and 100% said that the fabrics were soft and comfortable. 
WEEK 1

Diminish skin's imperfections
Smoother, more vibrant skin
Skin feels less flabby
In a Consumer Perception Survey after wearing for 1 week, 96% said that the products were comfortable, 81% said the product was more comfortable than similar garments they've worn in the page, 85% said that they would recommend this product. 
WEEKS 2-4
Average increase in skin elasticity of up to 19%
Firmer, clearer skin tone

*In a 4 week clinical study conducted by The Consumer Testing Institute amongst 27 women who wore the SKINEEZ® SKINCAREWEAR® for eight hours a day, 6 days a week, and used the SKINEEZ ® Garment Spray for the last 4 weeks.

Electrolytic Manganese Dioxide

Overview

Used in the manufacture of dry-cell alkaline batteries.

Product Information

Brand Name Electrolytic Manganese Dioxide (EMD)
Chemical NameManganese Dioxide
Manufacture LocationHenderson, Nevada USA
FormulaMnO2
Molecular Weight86.94
CAS Number1313-13-9
AppearanceBlackpowder
GradeAlkaline Battery (AB)
DescriptionAn electrolytic, battery-active manganese dioxide, primarily intended for use in alkaline batteries

Typical Chemical Analysis

ElementPercent Weight
Manganese (MnO2)92
Sulfate(SO4)1.25
Moisture(Free and Bound H2O)5
HCl insolubles0.06

Other Minor Constituents

Element PPM
Iron (Fe) 30
Titanium (Ti) 10
Fired Aluminum Oxide (Al2O3) 300
Sodium (Na) 2250
Potassium (K) 400
Calcium, Magnesium (Ca, Mg) 550
Heavy Metals (Cu, Co, Cr, Ni, V, Pb, Mo, Sb, As) 6

Typical Screen Analysis

U.S. Standard Sieve No. Percent Passing
200 (wet) 92%
325 (wet) 58%

ElectrolyticManganese Dioxide 

Other Properties

Property Value
pH (10 g in 200 ml H2O) 6.5
Scott Density 26.5 g/in3
Potential (Alkaline Mix) 1.64 volts

Packaging

Manganese dioxide is packaged in 50-pound five-ply paper bags and 3,000-pound supersacks.  Unitization on wood pallets with shrink film over-wrap is available for 50-pound bags.

Advanced Battery Materials

Overview

LMO-100 – Engineered for capacity

  • Superior power with good fade
  • Proprietary dopant for balanced performance
  • High density to maximize battery capacity
  • Excellent for power tools

LMO-200 – Engineered for cycle life

  • Superior capacity retention at 60° C
  • Patented dopants for outstanding temperature stability
  • Customizable
  • Ideal for HEVs, PHEVs and E-Bikes

LMO-300 – Engineered for cycle life and capacity

  • All-around performance: good capacity and low fade
  • Patented dopants to maximize power and rate capability
  • Customizable
  • Ideal for power tools, laptops, or blending with high-cost cathodes for improved safety, cost and performance

Elemental Boron﻿

Overview

Used in the igniter system of automobile airbags and military flares.

Used in the igniter system of automobile airbags and military flares.

Brand Name Trona® Elemental Boron
Chemical Name Elemental boron
Other Name Amorphous boron
Manufacture Location Henderson, Nevada  USA
Formula B
Molecular Weight 10.81
CAS Number 7440-42-8
Appearance Fine dark brown powder
B Isotopes Ratio as occurring in nature
Specifications Meets or exceeds the requirements of Specifications OS 11608 and Mil-B-51092

Typical Chemical Analysis

Element Percent Weight (typical) Percent Weight (specification)
Boron (net as B) 90 – 91 89.5 – 92.0
Water soluble Boron 0.4 – 0.5 0.52 (max)
Magnesium (Mg) 4.0 – 4.5 5 (max)
Insoluble in H2O2 0.15 – 0.30 1.0 (max)
Moisture 0.05 – 0.30 0.5 (max)

Typical Screen Analysis

U.S. Standard Sieve No. Percent Cumulative
20 10%
40 65%
60 90%
100 97%

Other Properties

Property Percent Weight (typical) Percent Weight (specification)
Surface Area (N2 BET) 15 – 25 m2/6 n/a
Average Particle Size 0.6 – 0.8 Microns 1.0 Microns (max)

Packaging

Elemental boron is packaged in five-pound (two-gallon) plastic buckets; 25-pound (eight-gallon) steel drums; and 50-pound (16-gallon) steel drums. Polyethylene liners are used in all containers.

Boron Trichloride

Overview

Used in semiconductor and pharmaceutical industries, as well as high-performance boron ﬁbers for aircraft parts and sporting equipment.

Product Information

Brand Name Trona® Boron Trichloride
Chemical Name Boron Trichloride
Manufacture Location Henderson, Nevada  USA
Formula BCl3
Molecular Weight 117.17
CAS Number 10294-34-5
Appearance Clear, colorless liquid or gas, fumes in air

Typical Chemical Analysis

Element   Standard High Purity Ultra Purity*
Boron Trichloride (BCl3) % weight 99.9% 99.99% 99.999%
Phosgene (COCl2) ppm <300 <10 <1
Silicon (Si) ppm <10 <5 <1
Chlorine ppm <2 <1 <0.5

Other Properties

Property Value
Density (liquid) at 12.5° C 1.346 g/cc
Density (vapor) at 12.6° C 5.00 g/l
Boiling Point at 760 torr 12.5° C
Melting Point -107° C

Packaging

Boron Trichloride is packaged in 100-pound net (DOT 4BW–400) and 1200-pound net (DOT 4BW-240) steel cylinders. Cylinders are strapped (metal) to wooden pallets prior to shipment. The 1200-pound cylinders are equipped with separate valves for liquid and/or gas dispensing. Labeled as DOT Hazard class – 2.3 (poison gas), 8, UN 1741 –

Poison Inhalation Hazard Zone C. Customer cylinders of varying sizes may be ﬁlled upon request.

About Elliott Wislar

Elliott built a Championship reputation in sailing, and has achieved the same reputation as a highly acclaimed business professional. He has held senior executive positions in marketing, distribution and Asset Management with FleetBoston, The Boston Company (a division of Bank of New York, Mellon, and UBS.).

In 2005, Elliott founded Clearbrook Global Advisors (Clearbrook) based upon the philosophy that the marketplace needed a financial advisory firm that provided client- centric solutions that at its core was dedicated to providing clients with non-conflicted and transparent advice. He has grown Clearbrook both domestically and internationally and advises and manages over $10 billion in assets today.

Elliott attributes Clearbrook’s success to his sense of humility and the ability to be able to “look at things a little differently. Elliott speaks passionately about his love of sailing and business. “In sailing we have a concept known as ‘Velocity Made Good.’ An experienced sailor avoids sailing too close into the wind or directly down wind, but instead accounts for variations such as currents, and wind changes, to maximize speed and reach the finish line first. Business,” Elliott continues, “is no different. We must constantly adjust our strategies to the ever-changing business climate to provide our clients with the optimum solutions for reaching their goals. The era of five-year business plans has disappeared and we must move at the speed of business. This demands we create and adjust 6-month tactical plans to stay ahead of our business competition and to assist our clients with the ever changing markets, just as we adjust our sails and positioning on our boat to actively maintain our edge.”

Nearly 60% of Clearbrook’s clients are Foundations and Endowments (half of those are religious in nature). Elliott has served on many Boards of Foundations and Endowments. He and his family created the Mary Elliott Memorial Scholarship Foundation to honor both the memory of his mother as a pioneer for women seeking higher education, and to create scholarships for women entering college as freshmen in New Jersey. Further, he understands the importance of a Fiduciary relationship as the cornerstone of Asset Management. As Elliott explains:

“In the spirit of the great Jurist, Benjamin Cardoza, A Fiduciary is held to something much stricter than simply the morals of the marketplace. A Fiduciary must not just demonstrate honesty, he must become, as Cardoza said, ‘the punctilio of an honor so sensitive, that it is the standard of all of his behavior.’ I take this role very seriously as does each and every member of our Clearbrook Team.”

Elliott has achieved success in business by applying wisdom and tactics from his greatest influencers: His Grandfather, who was the founder of several successful companies and taught Elliott a “Never-say-die” attitude, and four-star General and Commander of the U.S. Central Command, Norman Schwarzkopf, Jr., a Trenton, New Jersey native, who Elliott says, “showed his troops on the battlefield to never remain sedentary. Those that remain sedentary in business will never win the battle.”

Elliott Wakefield Wislar was educated at the University of Arizona with a BA in Political Science and an MBA in International Management with a focus in finance and Japanese language from The Thunderbird School of Global Management, Arizona State University. Elliott lives in Princeton, NJ, where his fourth-generation children were raised (Elliott Junior, Mackenzie and Wes). He enjoys sailing, fishing, golf, traveling the world, experiencing fine wine, reading and looking for new adventures.

High Energy Visible (HEV) light is the violet-blue radiation from 380-500 nm in the electromagnetic spectrum. This is the section of light closest to UV (ultra violet) light radiation.

Previously only the Sun emitted HEV light. However, now we are bombarded with HEV light from LED high-intensity street lights, strong blue fluorescent lighting, computer screens and many types of digital electronic devices.

Exposure to HEV light, sometimes called “blue light” or just “HEV”, is linked to cataracts and retinal conditions such as macular degeneration. Exposure to blue light can cause visual fatigue,digital eye strain and circadian rhythm sleep disturbance.

Epolin offers several dyes which effectively absorb HEV light. These dyes are sometimes called “blue blockers”. They can be used alone or combined with UV absorbers and other visible dyes for a tailored sun lens or filter formulation.

Every business could use financial resources to grow

Apply for the no-fee, no hassle PEO client-Credit Line roday

Your PEO cxcited to introduce a new service offering, the PEO Client-Credit Line. Provided in partnership with the Payroll Funding Company, the PEO Client-Credit Line provides our clients access to fast-working capital when needed.

Managing monthly cash-flow is both time-consuming and stressful. Delayed payments and unforeseen expenses pose challenges to a company's ability to focus on growth and efficiencies, Invesments in growth initiatives in the short-term.

The PEOPLE Credit-Line is an unsecured loan to use for any business need such as:

  • Paying payroll
  • Buying supplies or inventory
  • Purchasing a new piece of equipment
  • Hiring additional resources
  • Paying bills / debt consolidation
  • Restarting / growing after COVID shutdown

How Does the PEO Client-Credit Line Work?

Your PEOPLE has partnered with Payroll Funding Company to offer a credit-line that is a fast and flexible credit-line solution. Credit limits depend on business metries, but generally PEO clients qualify for lines of $15,000 - $150,000 based on a company's size.


Because of your relationship with Your PEO, loan terms are extremely favorable:


  • NO collateral
  • NO personal guarantee filing
  • NO application
  • NO tax returns
  • NO credit checks
  • NO covenants
  • NO origination, standby fees or renewal fees

What are the Terms?

A few numbers from your financial statements and a phone interview are all it takes to become pre-qualified. Once an agreement is in place, the PEO Client-Credit Live can be accessed any time over the next year. You only pay for what you borrow, and the payback terms are flexible. Need a short-term cash float or loan? Terms start at only 4% APR. You can extend payback for up to six months to give your business the time it needs.

No origination, standby, monthly or annual fees. The PEO Clients-Credit Line costs nothing until funds are drawn down.

Who is Payroll Funding?

Payroll Funding Company is the short-term investment arm of a family Trust that has provided short-term lending solutions to small and mid-size businesses for more than 20 years. As a Trust they have different legal, tax and operating requirements than most lenders, and take a long-term interest in the success of the clients. Payroll Funding does not borrow money, so it doesn't need to work under the same requirements and restrictions that other lenders have.

Provide link to subsequent pages perhaps something like this:

“To get more information or become instantly pre-qualified”

Or
Contact Steve Ott at:
steve@payrollfundings.com
(609)-516-5100

Please note: This is not an offer for a personal line of credit for your employees, but strictly for qualified businesses. Qualifications include being in business for three years or more, a payroll of $15,000 per cycle, positive cash from status and a client in good stading with your PEO.

Getting Started

The PEO Client-Credit Line is free to get and does not incur any fees until it is used. Need capital to grow your business? Have access to quick cash? Have a project coming up? Maybe just to have it “in case”.


Base Criteria:

  • Company should be at least 3 years old
  • Have a payroll of at least $15k per pay cycle
  • No prior bankruptcies
  • In good standing with your PEO

If you are interested in learning more Fill in the “Basic Data” below to contacted
